page.title: 10FARMING KIRKBY MALZEARD AREA
page.content: An area of pasture & meadow land between the Pennine moors & the Vale of York.Mainly{self-owned family farms of about 100acres{.Dairy & Beef cattle &{sheep}are equally important.{Poultry {& Pigs}kept on a very small scale.{Hay {& Silage}are the only crops,with straw bought in from nearby areas.Some village farms are smaller, a few worked on a part-time basis. Few employ outside labour being mainly run by fathers & sons. One farmer supplies a doorstep delivery of{farm-bottled {milk.}The rest send milk by tanker for processing. In 1984 the E.E.C. imposed a dairy quota on the British farmer causing, in this area, a cut back in dairy herds. Cattle & Sheep are bought & sold at local{auction marts.}1/3 of this area now qualifies for some financial aid as 'marginal' land (E.E.C. 1985).
